page.lettertext:
fol.24r
Understanding of the meeting of the states General [at this]
[Instant], and fearing that something may either be any [way]
concluded against us, that might hapen to be prejudicial [to the]
commerce betweene us and the m
r
chantes of bothe provinc[es we]
have once againe emboldened our selves to desire you to [be]
help full to our cause in all that you maye, and as we ha[ve]
especiall confidence that you will: And bicause we would [be]
advertised howe thinges passe from tyme to tyme, and [.]
litle troublesom unto you as we might, we have thought [good]
to dispatche our secretarie thether, whoe can futher e[.]
you of our matters and minde as there shalbe occasione [.]
And so leaving you to his reporte and wishing you all p[.]
in yo
r
affaires wee ende with our very harty comendat[ions]
from Middelburg the 15th of Marche a
o
1591:
Yo
r
wor
ps
affectionate and lovinge [.] Freendes the Deputye associates [.] Generality of the m
r
chantes adventu[rers] Thomas Ferrers Deputy
